intro: Tephroseris cladobotrys subsp. subfloccosa, commonly known as the floccose tephroseris, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
